data.title: Warn before closing the window when closing editor without having editor open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a few tabs/editors running in your window
2. cmd + w to close the current one, until no one is left
3. Next cmd + w will close the entire editor

Should warn the user that the entire editor will be closed and the choice to cancel.
This is just an idea since it happens all the time for me, though I understand the current implementation as it do exactly what the command says – closes the window.

![vscode_closes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/624182/16868799/f40f3714-4a79-11e6-944c-13a599703319.gif)

data.title: Feature request: Sync active document with explorer
data.body:
It would be nice to have a feature similar to Visual Studio's "Sync active document with solution explorer", for when you have `"explorer.autoReveal": false` to prevent the explorer jumping around, but still occasionally want to find the document you are working on.
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set `"explorer.autoReveal": false`
2. Want to manually jump to active document in solution explorer, but can find no such command

data.title: Extensions: Custom menu label for contributes.menus
Regex lookahead not working with replace
data.body:
_Reported by @widarlein:_

**Sample:**

```
username: apa
password: bepa
```

**Static replace:**
Pattern: `(.+)(?=:)`
Replace: `bapap`

Only works with Replace All. Not with single Replace.

**Capturing replace:**
Pattern: `(.+)(?=:)`
Replace: `"$1"`

Nothing happens when trying to do a replace. 

VSCode 1.4.0-insider
Win10

data.title: Configuration to hide debug toolbar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi I dont know if this is a vscode issue or cordova plugin issue. But here it goes.
- VSCode Version:1.3.1
- OS Version: OSX (latest)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. fire up your cordova project
2. run the project (F5)
3. try to change tabs.. 

Here it is easy to see that the run/debug/step into popup overlays with the new tabs for the files - hence makes it a bit hard to work and focus (see attachment).

![screen shot 2016-07-15 at 09 09 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1841838/16866447/4686e5cc-4a6c-11e6-95e2-22fbd3111b6e.png)

data.title: Focus vanishes after refactoring in GO
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 Commit e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a GO project
2. Select a symbol
3. Press F2
4. Rename symbol
5. Symbol is renamed, but focus is somewhere outside the editor.

You can press 18 times TAB or 5 times Shift+TAB to get the focus back to where it was.
ALso Ctrl+TAB two times works.

data.title: Deleting or renaming a file or its parent with dirty within should prompt user
data.body:
Getting lots of bugs that result from the fact that we do not prompt when renaming, moving or deleting a parent or file that is dirty. Should just prompt the user when this happens.

Related:
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1350
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6864

data.title: Add boolean setting to control whether editor should jump to active file in files list.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: 10.10.5

On large projects with many files and subdirectories, it can be annoying when switching between active files in the editor, **_also jumps to_** the actively selected file in the files list.

It would be great if the editor (preferably via a setting) only highlighted the active file in the files list **_without_** jumping to the file so as to keep current file list scroll position.

This would help when flipping between files in directory `A` and directory `Z`, while needing to keep an eye on structure of directory `A` in a large project where there are too many files between both directories for them to fit in same file list view.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open large project with many files and directories. 
2. Expand a directory near top of file list containing many files such that they fill the entire files list (ie. `node_modules` directory with many modules). Open a file in this directory.
3. Expand a directory near the bottom of the entire files list in a new tab.
4. Flip between the two files and notice the scroll position of files list changes.
5. There is no way to keep the scroll position of files list at the top.

data.title: Allow toggle line comment accurately when language only support nested block comment

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11 Beta

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a language mode which only support block comment. (eg. OCaml)
2. Write one line code contains a comment inline. (eg. `let x = 1 (* foo *)`)
3. Toggle line comment at that line. (eg. expect `(*let x = 1 (* foo *)*)`, but got `let x = 1 foo`)

If block comment can't be nested. We should not change the line `let x = 1 (* foo *)`, because we are toggling **LINE COMMENT**, not block comment.

data.title: Auto indenting python code

Fix for #3754
Changes to add onEnter rules for python code

Note: I'm not sure how the code in the extension (take the [php](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/tree/master/extensions/php) extension for example) gets built. I manually ran the build scripts defined within the package.json for the python extension in this PR.

data.title: Extensions: support for custom item in Tasks: Configure Task Runner

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm working on a new extension for a language, and I'd love the ability to add an item to the list shown when you create "Tasks: Configure Task Runner" command. If that's possible now, I just can't seem to find it in the documentation.

See the following quick-and-dirty mockup:

![custom-task-runner](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/141885/16858868/fcade1fe-49de-11e6-8def-d9553460f643.png)

We can add custom items to "Debug: open launch.json" using contributes:debuggers in the extension's package.json, so there is precedence for this sort of thing.

The reason I would like this API is so that I can create a template for the tasks.json file that runs a specific executable, similar to how "TypeScript - tsconfig.json" runs "tsc" or "MSBuild" runs "msbuild". That's easier for users than having to choose "Other" and enter the details manually.

Thank you!

data.title: Previewing files in folder marks them as unsaved
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Win 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder
2. Randomly select files to view their contents.
3. Files get marked as unsaved - even though nothing was changed. 

This leaves a trail of all opened files which are marked as unsaved. To close them you have to individually click the "Dont save" button on prompt.

data.title: Can't install some extensions behind a corporate proxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601](Windows 7)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VS Code.
2. CTRL+P → `ext install npm intellisense` (for instance) → In the side menu, click install.
3. A clock icon appears on the extension icon in the left side of the window. 
4. Nothing else happens. 

I can, however, install some extensions like ESLINT. My guess is that some of those extensions are stored on a different address, and my proxy is blocking access to it. However, I can't determine the URL of the extension package so I'm unable to check if this is the case.

Thanks a lot.

data.title: Keeping open file history
data.body:
So, one thing I really liked about 1.2 and prior, is files did not belong to an "editor" (pane). It was one of my favorite things about vscode. I can open and close editors when ever I want. Sometimes something is not relevant or I want more room for one file, so I will close other editors. Keeping files and editors separate lets you move around your codebase without worrying about losing history. I thought this was a bug at first, since I have both tabs and "open editors" hidden in the UI as I don't need or use them.

Via twitter I heard these new split editor features were wildly requested. Feature requests are easy to make, but its hard to vote on _keeping_ a feature that you already like.

My suggestion would be to keep the awesome work you did with tabs, but maybe store all open files in a single list also. So any time you open a file, it gets pushed to that list, while also being associated to and editor for tabs and what not.

Thoughts?

<3
- VSCode Version:
  1.3
- OS Version:
  OSX

data.title: Changing a parent folder's name causes loss of unsaved file changes.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Edit a file in a sub-folder, but do not save it.
2. Rename the sub-folder.

The file will still be marked as dirty, however it will no longer appear in the OPEN EDITORS section and all changes will be lost.

Possibly related to issue [#1350](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1350).

data.title: Feature Request: "enum" launch config variable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## Current

``` json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "run AVM",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/node-lambda",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": ["run", "--eventFile=events/local/avm.json"],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "preLaunchTask": null,
      "runtimeExecutable": null,
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--nolazy"
      ],
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development",
        "DEBUG" : "*"
      },
      "externalConsole": false,
      "sourceMaps": false,
      "outDir": null
    },
    {
      "name": "run Recorder",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/node-lambda",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": ["run", "--eventFile=events/local/recorder.json"],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "preLaunchTask": null,
      "runtimeExecutable": null,
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--nolazy"
      ],
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development",
        "DEBUG" : "*"
      },
      "externalConsole": false,
      "sourceMaps": false,
      "outDir": null
    },
    {
      "name": "run tax-assessor",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/node-lambda",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": ["run", "--eventFile=events/local/tax-assessor.json"],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "preLaunchTask": null,
      "runtimeExecutable": null,
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--nolazy"
      ],
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development",
        "DEBUG" : "*"
      },
      "externalConsole": false,
      "sourceMaps": false,
      "outDir": null
    }
  ]
}
```
## Desired

``` json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Launch",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/node-lambda",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": ["run", "--eventFile=events/local/${enum:('avm.json','recorder.json','tax-assessor.json')"],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "preLaunchTask": null,
      "runtimeExecutable": null,
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--nolazy"
      ],
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development",
        "DEBUG" : "*"
      },
      "externalConsole": false,
      "sourceMaps": false,
      "outDir": null
    }
  ]
}
```
## UI

like this one: ![](https://code.visualstudio.com/images/June_2016_attach_to_process.png)

data.title: Fails to open SD temp file when doing SD CHANGE if VS Code is already open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set VS Code settings.json to include "window.openFilesInNewWindow": false
2. In your Source Depot setenv.cmd, set VS Code as your default editor with: set SDEDITOR="c:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\code.exe"
3. Have VS Code open with a file loaded.  Doesn't matter what, just needs to already be open
4.  From your enlistment, make a code change and run SD CHANGE
   --> That should bring up a .tmp file to allow you to enter a description.  Instead, you get an error "Unable to open 't18832t1.tmp': A system error occured (ENOENT: no such file or directory, stat 'c:\temp\system\csrcrs1_refresh\t18832t1.tmp')."

If VS Code isn't already running prior to step 4, this works correctly.  Or, if you omit step 1, it works correctly.

data.title: Extension is not properly activated if a command is executed via context menu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 + 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new instance of vscode
2. Execute a command from "editor/title" or "explorer/context" menu. ("Open Preview" on a markdown file)
3. The context menu closes and opens again
4. Click the context menu item again
5. The command is executed

_If you open the context menu and wait for a few seconds before clicking the menu item, the command is executed directly._
